posts.message:
[align=center][img]https://hackforums.news/assets/v3/406.png[/img][/align]

[align=center][url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=561239][img]https://hackforums.news/assets/v3/Headlines/Vitani.png[/img][/url][/align]

[b][color=white]Red Lions Usergroup Removed[/color][/b]
On the first of September, [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][b][color=#9999FF]Omniscient[/color][/b][/url] announced the Red Lions group had been removed. It was removed because the owner of Red Lions, [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=80618][b]nokia2mon2[/b][/url] has been offline for over two years. The group and forum are still in the database, but if [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=80618][b]nokia2mon2[/b][/url] does not return to HF within 6 months, it will be permanently deleted. [i][size=x-small][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5880380] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Byte Bonus Weekend[/color][/b]
September 1st, [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][b][color=#9999FF]Omniscient[/color][/b][/url] announced the Byte Bonus weekend. In this weekend, members will be able to earn more bytes for the threads, posts, and replies they make and get. For every thread made you'll get 5 Bytes, for every post 2 Bytes and for every reply to one of your threads you'll get 0.2 Bytes instead of the usual 0.1! Aside from this bonus, [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][b][color=#9999FF]Omniscient[/color][/b][/url] also announced a limited time offer for everyone on the forums. If you donate for the Grand Amethyst award, you'll now get an additional 50,000 Bytes as a bonus. If you're looking to donate to HF and get some bytes in the process, in addition to the award itself, now is the time to do so! [i][size=x-small][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5880400] >>Source[1][/url][/size][/i] [i][size=x-small][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5880526] >>Source[2][/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Share Button on Posts[/color][/b]
Another new feature was released the first of September. We now have an official share button on posts! The announcement was made by [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=175033][b][color=#9999FF]Xerotic[/color][/b][/url], who worked on this feature with [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][b][color=#9999FF]Omniscient[/color][/b][/url]. Users are now able to share posts on social media, such as Twitter, Facebook, and Google+. In addition to that, users are also able to quickly copy the link to a post, or copy the MyBB code to get the citation for the post. [i][size=x-small][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5880545] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[align=center][url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=3322334][img]https://i.imgur.com/H5MRIbN.png[/img][/url][/align]

[b][color=white]Air Pollution Erodes Intelligence[/color][/b] 
While the fact that breathing polluted air is not good for intelligence may not surprise you, the effects of it sure might. A study, from Yale School of Public Health, found that the effects could be as bad as losing an entire year of school. It is true that this study was conducted in China, but it does have rippling effects throughout the planet. Xi Chen, the author of this study, had to say, “Polluted air can cause everyone to reduce their level of education by one year, which is huge, but we know the effect is worse for the elderly, especially those over 64, and for men, and for those with low education. If we calculate [the loss] for those, it may be a few years of education.” We had known prior that it damages the brain in school-aged children, but this shows just how high up it can go. [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2018/aug/27/air-pollution-causes-huge-reduction-in-intelligence-study-reveals]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Alzheimer's Treatment Successfully Tested in Mice[/color][/b] 
In neuroscience this week, a new Alzheimer's treatment has been tested on mice which slows the advancement of brain deterioration. This treatment, which is a modified protein, blocked the toxic effects of the degenerative disease which cause the rapid loss of brain cells. Prior we have solely been able to desperately stave off the degeneration as long as possible. This article goes fairly in-depth about how this treatment would work; I highly recommend anyone interested read through the article. [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2018/aug/27/air-pollution-causes-huge-reduction-in-intelligence-study-reveals]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]



[align=center][img]https://i.imgur.com/lv4d7BY.png[/img][/align]

[b][color=white]Anti-vaccine fears fuel measles outbreak in Europe — nearly 40 fatalities to date[/color][/b] 
In an outbreak fueled by anti-vaccine fears, measles is back, and it has already taken the lives of many children and adults in Europe. Between the years of 1855 and 2005, the disease is said to have taken the lives of approximately 200 million people internationally, being classified for one of the most tragic and infamous outbreaks in [i]recent[/i] history. Though, since the first measles vaccine was developed in 1963, fatalities have seen an impeccable decline over the recent years. In just the past few years, a stunning anti-vaccine movement has slowly gained traction by many. Initially, the movement was ignored and brushed aside, though current day, the anti-scientific movement “has grown to the point where it’s having an important impact: scaring people away from vaccines and making everyone more vulnerable to the threat of diseases like measles.” Every year, more and more people avoid vaccines that have been developed to fight against measles, mumps, and rubella, and as expected, the disease has now made its way back into modern society, in an almost overwhelming fashion. “Two years ago, in 2016, there were 5,273 measles cases. In 2017, it grew to 23,927, and this year, in the first six months alone, there were over 41,000 cases — culminating in 37 fatalities.” [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.zmescience.com/medicine/antivaxx-measles-outbreak-europe-28082018/]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]McDonald’s condemned for using chickens that suffer heart failure[/color][/b] 
A new outrage being constructed by animal activists and McDonald’s critics has arisen– for allegedly using chickens that suffer heart failure because of the number of steroids being provided in order to grow at a rapid rate. According to campaigners, common items from the McDonald’s menu such as chicken sandwiches, salads, and McNuggets, all contain chicken that was selectively chosen and bred specifically over time to amass a higher weight than when naturally bred, which causes “painful health problems.” McDonald’s recently issued new guidelines regarding animal-welfare policy, commanding suppliers to follow updated standards by the year 2024 for “raising and slaughtering chickens, including increasing the amount and brightness of light in chicken houses and providing birds with access to perches that promote natural behavior.” McDonald’s has pledged to conduct trials with suppliers to ensure that all partners are following guidelines to uphold the wellbeing of the chickens. The pain endured by these animals is caused by the rapid growth of their bones, while their organs are unable to keep up. In an additional statement, the critics also claim that this causes oversized upper bodies being the root for leg pain and lameness, where they sometimes collapse under their own overwhelming weight, all at the same time placing intense pressure on their hearts, often resulting in a premature death due to heart disease.  [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/home-news/mcdonald-s-chickens-mcnuggets-salad-welfare-breed-humane-league-a8506381.html]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]
